elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-slider value="50" min="1" max="100"></px-slider>

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:---------------|:-------------
`--px-slider-border-color` | Border color for the unselected portion of the slider
`--px-slider-border-color--selected` | Border color for the selected portion of the slider
`--px-slider-border-color--disabled` | Border color for the unselected portion of the slider when disabled
`--px-slider-progress-border-color--disabled` | Border color for the selected portion of the slider when disabled
|
`--px-slider-background-color` | Background color for the unselected portion of the slider
`--px-slider-background-color--selected` | Background color for the selected portion of the slider
`--px-slider-background-color--hover` | Background color for the selected portion of the slider when hovered
`--px-slider-background-color--pressed` | Background color for the selected portion of the slider when pressed
`--px-slider-background-color--disabled` | Background color for the unselected portion of the slider when disabled
`--px-slider-progress-background-color--disabled` | Background color for the selected portion of the slider when disabled
|
`--px-handle-stroke-color` | Border color for the handle
`--px-handle-stroke-color--hover` | Border color for the handle when hovered
`--px-handle-stroke-color--active` | Border color for the handle when pressed
`--px-handle-color--disabled` | Border color for the handle when disabled
|
`--px-handle-background-color` | Background color for the handle
`--px-handle-background-color--hover` | Background color for the handle when hovered
`--px-handle-background-color--active` | Background color for the handle when pressed
`--px-handle-background-color--disabled` | Background color for the handle when disabled
|
`--px-slider-label-color` | Text color for the min/max labels

properties.name: _parentResizable
properties.description: The closest ancestor element that implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

properties.name: _notifyingDescendant
properties.description:
True if this element is currently notifying its descendant elements of
resize.

properties.name: format
properties.description:
The format used to generate the output. Set to a [valid numbro.js
format string](http://numbrojs.com/format.html).

Set to "NONE" to skip formatting and use the `value` to set the
`formattedValue` directly.

properties.name: currency
properties.description: Specify whether the value should be formatted as a currency

properties.name: culture
properties.description: Provide localization for currency formatting

properties.name: zeroFormat
properties.description: Provide a new default format for `0` value

properties.name: _height
properties.description: Height of the svg: calculated from container size

properties.name: _width
properties.description: Width of the svg: calculated from container size

properties.name: _margin
properties.description: Margin for the svg elems centering the bars and providing space around them for the handles

properties.name: value
properties.description:
For single sliders: the value for the slider's handle.
For multi-handled/ranged sliders: the value for the left / start slider's handle.

properties.name: endValue
properties.description: For multi-handled/ranged sliders only: the value of the right handle / end of the selected range.

properties.name: formattedStartValue
properties.description: The display value for the left input box

properties.name: formattedEndValue
properties.description: The display value for the right input box

properties.name: min
properties.description: A minimum value for the slider. The user cannot choose less than the min.

properties.name: max
properties.description: A maximum value for the slider. The user cannot choose greater than the max.

properties.name: _minMaxValid
properties.description: A trigger that is greater than 0 if the min and max are valid

properties.name: step
properties.description:
Specifies the step size for the slider values.

For example:
Setting step to 10 limits values to multiples of 10 over the min value.
The default of 1 ensures that you only get integers for your value.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: A boolean reflecting whether the slider is disabled or not.

properties.name: hideInputs
properties.description: A boolean reflecting whether the text input fields should be hidden.

properties.name: _showStartInput
properties.description: A boolean specifying if the first input box should be shown

properties.name: _showEndInput
properties.description: A boolean specifying if the second input box should be shown

properties.name: isRange
properties.description: Boolean specifying if we are dealing with a single slider or a range

properties.name: scale
properties.description:
The scale by which the slider operates - currently supports:
- `linear`
- `logarithmic`
- `exponential`

properties.name: base
properties.description: The base number only for logarithmic scales

properties.name: exponent
properties.description: The exponent number only for exponential scales

properties.name: _scale
properties.description: Holder object for the scale function

properties.name: _scaleChanged
properties.description: A trigger for changes in the scale range or domain

properties.name: _startHandle
properties.description: A holder for the handle d3 selected elem

properties.name: _endHandle
properties.description: A holder for the handle d3 selected elem

properties.name: _progressBar
properties.description: A holder for the progress bar d3 selected elem

properties.name: _backgroundTrack
properties.description: A holder for the background track d3 selected elem

properties.name: _inputStart
properties.description: A holder for the start input elem

properties.name: _inputEnd
properties.description: A holder for the end input elem

properties.name: _minLabel
properties.description: A holder for the min label

properties.name: _maxLabel
properties.description: A holder for the max label

properties.name: _format
properties.description: The format string used to format the number in the input box

properties.name: showLabels
properties.description: Specifies if the min and max slider labels should be shown

properties.name: minLabelPosition
properties.description:
The vertical location for the Min label. Valid values are:
- 'bottom' (default)
- 'top'

properties.name: maxLabelPosition
properties.description:
The vertical location for the Max label. Valid values are:
- 'bottom' (default)
- 'top'

properties.name: _handleDefinitions
properties.description: The path definitions for the handles

properties.name: _transformX
properties.description: For FF fix: The amount we need to add to our mouse vals for them to be correct

properties.name: _searchForTransforms
properties.description: For FF fix

properties.name: _transformEventName
properties.description: For FF fix

methods.name: notifyResize
methods.description:
Can be called to manually notify a resizable and its descendant
resizables of a resize change.

methods.name: assignParentResizable
methods.description:
Used to assign the closest resizable ancestor to this resizable
if the ancestor detects a request for notifications.

methods.name: stopResizeNotificationsFor
methods.description:
Used to remove a resizable descendant from the list of descendants
that should be notified of a resize change.

methods.name: resizerShouldNotify
methods.description:
This method can be overridden to filter nested elements that should or
should not be notified by the current element. Return true if an element
should be notified, or false if it should not be notified.

params.name: element
params.description:
A candidate descendant element that
implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

return.desc: True if the `element` should be notified of resize.

methods.name: generateRandomID
methods.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: _animationFrame
methods.description:
Do general setup on our svg once we have an animation frame and know stuff exists
- create listeners
- draw our handles

methods.name: _setupListeners
methods.description: Setup our listeners

methods.name: _createHandleListeners
methods.description: Creates the drag behavior and hover, pressed states for the handles.

methods.name: _createTrackListeners
methods.description: Creates the click listeners on the progress bars to enable click to jump value

methods.name: _trackOnClick
methods.description: The actual callback for our track on click

methods.name: _removeHandleListeners
methods.description: Clears the listeners from the handles

methods.name: _removeTrackListeners
methods.description: clears the listeners from the track

methods.name: _buildHandles
methods.description:
For flexibility and efficiency, the basic paths and lines are already loaded into the dom.
We just need to actually add paths, etc so they are not invisible, which is what this function does.
This way, we dont have to do special setup in range vs single mode, just dont draw the other handle
when in single mode and just morph the drawing of the single handle when in range mode.

methods.name: _assignInputElems
methods.description: saves our input fields as a property for conveinence

methods.name: _onIronResize
methods.description: Resizes the slider based on parent box size

methods.name: _hideInputsChanged
methods.description: Shows or hides the input boxes based on settings. Triggers the dom-ifs in the Template

methods.name: _getSvgWidth
methods.description: Returns the width to be used for the svg

methods.name: _getSvgHeight
methods.description: Returns the height to be used for the svg

methods.name: _calcTransform
methods.description: Calculates the transform for the svg elems

methods.name: _stepChanged
methods.description: Validates that the step property is valid value

methods.name: _minOrMaxChanged
methods.description: Validates the the min and max values to ensure that the min is < the max

methods.name: _createScale
methods.description: Creates a scale which translate pixel coordinates into our data values

methods.name: _createScaleDebounced
methods.description: Creates a scale for realz

methods.name: _setRange
methods.description: Set our scale's range: the pixel max and min to use in the translation

methods.name: _setRangeDebouced
methods.description: Set our scale's range for realz

methods.name: _setDomain
methods.description: Set our scale's domain: the data max and min to use in the translation

methods.name: _setDomainDebounced
methods.description: Set our scale's domain for realz

methods.name: _calcSliderValue
methods.description: Calculate the slider handle value from the mouse position

methods.name: _calcSliderValueDebounced
methods.description: Calculate the slider handle value for realz

methods.name: _calcStepRounded
methods.description: Rounds the raw pixel translated value to one that matches our step size

methods.name: _validateValue
methods.description: Validate the value

methods.name: _valueChanged
methods.description: When the value property changes, sync the handle position

methods.name: _endValueChanged
methods.description: When the endValue property changes, sync the handle position

methods.name: _moveHandle
methods.description: Apply a transform to the handle to move it

methods.name: _calcProgressStart
methods.description: Update the starting point of the progress bar based on the value property and isRange

methods.name: _calcProgressEnd
methods.description: Update the end point of the progress bar based on the value property or endValue property

methods.name: _updateFormat
methods.description: Updates the formating string for nubmer-formatter

methods.name: _inputChangedStart
methods.description: User has changed the text in the left input field

methods.name: _inputChangedEnd
methods.description: User has changed the text in the right input field

methods.name: _inputChanged
methods.description: When an input field has changed, validates the input and sets the value property

methods.name: _restoreStartInputValue
methods.description: If the user hits ESC on an input field, reset the display value

methods.name: _restoreEndInputValue
methods.description: If the user hits ESC on an input field, reset the display value

methods.name: _restoreInputValue
methods.description: Reset the display value in the input field to the coresponding value property

methods.name: _checkEndValue
methods.description: Checks the value of the endValue on initialization to ensure it is valid

methods.name: _isRangeChanged
methods.description: Fired when isRange changes value to turn the slider into a range slider or single slider

methods.name: _toggleDisabledClass
methods.description: Sets disabled  styles

attributes.name: format
attributes.description:
The format used to generate the output. Set to a [valid numbro.js
format string](http://numbrojs.com/format.html).

Set to "NONE" to skip formatting and use the `value` to set the
`formattedValue` directly.

attributes.name: currency
attributes.description: Specify whether the value should be formatted as a currency

attributes.name: culture
attributes.description: Provide localization for currency formatting

attributes.name: zero-format
attributes.description: Provide a new default format for `0` value

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
For single sliders: the value for the slider's handle.
For multi-handled/ranged sliders: the value for the left / start slider's handle.

attributes.name: end-value
attributes.description: For multi-handled/ranged sliders only: the value of the right handle / end of the selected range.

attributes.name: formatted-start-value
attributes.description: The display value for the left input box

attributes.name: formatted-end-value
attributes.description: The display value for the right input box

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: A minimum value for the slider. The user cannot choose less than the min.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: A maximum value for the slider. The user cannot choose greater than the max.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description:
Specifies the step size for the slider values.

For example:
Setting step to 10 limits values to multiples of 10 over the min value.
The default of 1 ensures that you only get integers for your value.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: A boolean reflecting whether the slider is disabled or not.

attributes.name: hide-inputs
attributes.description: A boolean reflecting whether the text input fields should be hidden.

attributes.name: is-range
attributes.description: Boolean specifying if we are dealing with a single slider or a range

attributes.name: scale
attributes.description:
The scale by which the slider operates - currently supports:
- `linear`
- `logarithmic`
- `exponential`

attributes.name: base
attributes.description: The base number only for logarithmic scales

attributes.name: exponent
attributes.description: The exponent number only for exponential scales

attributes.name: show-labels
attributes.description: Specifies if the min and max slider labels should be shown

attributes.name: min-label-position
attributes.description:
The vertical location for the Min label. Valid values are:
- 'bottom' (default)
- 'top'

attributes.name: max-label-position
attributes.description:
The vertical location for the Max label. Valid values are:
- 'bottom' (default)
- 'top'
